meanings.definition: To take the place of (someone or something previously in authority or use)
meanings.sent1: The new manager superseded the old one.
meanings.sent2: The digital clock superseded the old analog one.
meanings.sent3: The young prince superseded his aging father in ruling the kingdom.
meanings.sent4: Technology has superseded many traditional methods of communication.
meanings.sent5: The rising sun superseded the darkness of the night.

meanings.definition: To replace (something old or outdated) with something new or better
meanings.sent1: The modern smartphone superseded the old flip phone.
meanings.sent2: The updated software superseded the buggy version.
meanings.sent3: The new recipe superseded the bland one, much to everyone's delight.
meanings.sent4: The fresh coat of paint superseded the peeling one, transforming the room.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of spring superseded the dullness of winter.
